meanings.definition: A person who listens or pays attention.
meanings.sent1: The hearkeners in the audience were focused on the speaker.
meanings.sent2: The hearkeners at the meeting nodded in agreement.
meanings.sent3: The hearkeners in the library were so quiet, you could hear a pin drop.
meanings.sent4: She was a hearkener to the whispers of the wind, finding peace in its gentle words.
meanings.sent5: The hearkeners in the forest could detect even the faintest rustle of leaves.

meanings.definition: Those who give heed or attention.
meanings.sent1: The hearkeners in the courtroom listened intently to every word.
meanings.sent2: As hearkeners to the wise advice, they avoided making hasty decisions.
meanings.sent3: The hearkeners in the movie theater gasped in unison at the unexpected plot twist.
meanings.sent4: She became a hearkener to the rhythm of the city, finding comfort in its bustling sounds.
meanings.sent5: The hearkeners in the crowd caught every detail of the performer's graceful movements.
